document.heading: Health Occupations Revision Exemption Temporary Amendment Act of 2025

To amend, on a temporary basis, the District of Columbia Health Occupations Revision Act of 1985 to authorize an exemption from licensure for health professionals licensed in foreign countries who accompany foreign sports teams participating in athletic competitions in the District.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Health Occupations Revision Exemption Temporary Amendment Act of 2025".

section.text: Section 502(a) of the District of Columbia Health Occupations Revision Act of 1985, effective March 25, 1986 (D.C. Law 6-99; D.C. Official Code ยง 3-1205.02(a)), is amended by adding a new paragraph (3B) to read as follows:

para.text: To an individual licensed, registered, or certified in good standing to practice a health occupation in another country who is in the District to attend to the healthcare needs of an athletic team from another country that is competing in an organized sporting event, as defined by section 3(3A) of the District of Columbia Smoking Restriction Act of 1979, effective September 28, 1979 (D.C. Law 3-22; D.C. Official Code ยง 7-1702(3A)); provided, that:

The time period during which the exemption to the provisions of this act prohibiting the practice of a health occupation without a District of Columbia license, registration, or certification shall not exceed 30 consecutive days;

The exemption shall be limited to healthcare provided to the athletes, support personnel, and coaching staff of the athletic team at the team basecamp, lodging, and training sites, and at the site of any matches within the District while the team is competing in those matches; and
The exemption shall not provide authority to the individual to practice at a healthcare clinic or facility in the District; or

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Chief Financial Officer as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code ยง 1-301.47a).

para.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto) and a 30-day period of congressional review as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Official Code ยง 1-206.02(c)(1)).
This act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.
